description:
Animated adaptation of Level-5's Nintendo 3DS video game.

While going deeper into the woods one day, primary school student Keita Amano ('Nate' in the English localisation) notices a bizarre capsule toy machine who tells him to insert money which he obeyingly does. But after opening the capsule that came out, a ghostly creature named Whisper materialises. Whisper, who was sealed inside the capsule, rewards his liberator Keita by becoming his Yo-kai butler and gives him a Yo-kai Watch. Whoever wears the watch gains the ability to see supernatural creatures called Yo-kai, each type possessing different kinds of magical abilities, and which are normally invisible to humans. The Yo-kai Watch also allows the wearer to summon any Yo-kai they have befriended, enabling the wearer to make use of the Yo-kai's powers. Using it, Keita and Whisper encounter many mischievous Yo-kai around town, resolving the trouble they're causing and befriending many at the same time.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

node.description:
__Birthplace:__ Hiroshima Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Hiroshima Prefectural High School, Toyo University

__Shinji Ushiro__ is a Japanese director, production manager and storyboard artist, who mainly does episode direction.
Akira Shigino is an anime director. He's a member of JAniCA.

__Birthplace:__ Hiroshima Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Hiroshima Prefectural High School, Toyo University

__Shinji Ushiro__ is a Japanese director, production manager and storyboard artist, who mainly does episode direction.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [color designer](https://anilist.co/staff/120600/)._

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fringon/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fringon) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/pedro.alcantara.1610) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@fringontv) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@_fringon) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/fringon)

Pedro Alcântara Machado de Vasconcelos (Jacareí, November 22, 1994) is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, singer and dubbing director. He is the son of voice actor [Ricardo Vasconcelos](https://anilist.co/staff/202508/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Pablo (1st voice - 1st-3rd season; The Backyardigans)
- Beck Oliver (Victorious)
- Tyler Navarro / Dino Charge Red Ranger (Power Rangers: Dino Charge)
- Coby (One Piece Live Action)
- Kim Dong-Ha (Happy Ending)
- Reminald R. "Remy" Remington (Big City Greens)
- Bradley Nicholson (Milo Murphy's Law)
- Charles Ronson (Horizon Zero Dawn)
- Hae-Rang (Sweet Home)
- Howard "Howie" (High School Musical: The Musical: The Series)
- Silas Plaskett (The Walking Dead: World Beyond)
- Charles "Charlie" St. George (13 Reasons Why)
- Ron Stoppable (Kim Possible Live Action)
!~

**Hans-Petter Moen** is a Norwegian actor and musician. He's most know for being in the band Cheezy Keys. Where he played with [Morten Bergheim](https://anilist.co/staff/225034/Morten-Bergheim), [Kim Arne Hagen](https://anilist.co/staff/237992/Kim-Arne-Hagen) and Kjærand Moe.
**Daniel Grubben** is a Norwegian translator at SDI Media.
Audio Engineer, editor and music director at TransPerfect Media Poland and Iyuno Poland.
Husband of [Ewa Serwa](https://anilist.co/staff/261560) and father of [Zuzanna Galia](https://anilist.co/staff/249503/).
